group_1.textRight: Or perhaps will you come to us@and we will crush the west together?
You can both kill Yachiyo Nanami and her side,@as well as spread your sorrow.
We were being impacted by the Magius' plans@without ever knowing...
And now you've been sold out by the west@without even knowing too.
You must be feeling the same way as us?
You should be honest with your feelin's.

group_1.textLeft: ...To make it clear, if I were to approach them and@read their minds, the truth would be revealed to me.
However, I've not dared to do so.
It was my way of testing Iroha and Yachiyo@to see how much I can trust them.

group_1.textRight: Then...what was the outcome of that?

group_1.textLeft: That they are easier to trust than I thought.

group_1.textRight: Isn't that because you don't want to doubt them@yourself?

group_1.textLeft: It's because we Kamihama Magical Girls@don't have a simple history ourselves.
Conflict between the east and west happen often,@and has been discussed time and time again.
We were able to come to compromise,@to know each other, even now.
The faith I've held for those girls has been nurtured.
The only one who was suspicious to me was Iroha,
but all of you injuring me at the previous battle@in the old trainyard
ended up being just the deed that was necessary.
One day, Iroha, you had told me that@foolishness is a virtue...
I don't understand it logically,@and would rather rebuke it,
but that pure, foolish reasoning@I find to be charming.
I think the true answer lies beyond normal understanding.
It gave me an opportunity to reevaluate her...

group_1.textRight: So you won't break then, will you?

group_1.textLeft: Apologies, but I like Iroha and Yachiyo@more than I realized.
